description: The OpenRAW committee developed the ORW format to store image, video, or audio data in a human-readable format, optimized for fast machine reading, and small in size while being secure and compatible. Typically, you will likely encounter ORW files that store camera raw image data. In these cases, the format contains uncompressed image data exactly how the camera's sensor captured it.
The OpenRAW format consists of several sections, including Magic, Parent labels, Main data, Thumbnail data, and Child labels. For example, the OpenRAW format storing image data may appear as follows:
